name: Hippuric acid
Relationship: Benzoic acid seems to be an analogue.

Head: Pain over right eye, dull, constant, worse in warm room
Eyelids inflamed and swollen
Female: Menstrual flow for three weeks with complete relief of muscular and joint pains
Skin: Papules looking like goose flesh on chest
Throat: Sore, raw, dry, swallowing difficult, foul odor, gummy exudate; thickness and infiltration of all tissues around throat
Extremities: Pain in middle of thigh posteriorly shooting down right leg
Pain in shoulders and extremities and sore swollen joints
Tired, grating sensation in the joints

details: Its chief action is on the external tissues of the eyes and nasopharynx, joint surfaces, liver and mucous membranes. Right side especially affected, general muscular soreness.
Natural History: Proved by Dr. W. B. Griggs
